thread.section_title: Play stopped at Miami Open as Iguana runs around the court during Tommy Haas v Jiri Vesely – Metro
thread.title: Play stopped at Miami Open as Iguana runs around the court during Tommy Haas v Jiri Vesely
thread.title_full: Play stopped at Miami Open as Iguana runs around the court during Tommy Haas v Jiri Vesely

author: George Bellshaw
title: Play stopped at Miami Open as Iguana runs around the court during Tommy Haas v Jiri Vesely
text:
For those not watching, there’s an iguana perched courtside at the Miami Open tennis tournament: pic.twitter.com/392faa3Rnf 
— Jonathan Tannenwald (@jtannenwald) March 22, 2017 
A tennis match at the Miami Open was rudely interrupted by a pesky intruder as an iguana ran onto the court.
Tommy Haas and Jiri Vesely were battling through a deciding set in their first-round match at the Masters 1000 event when the reptile found itself at the centre of attention.
The players were forced to stop as the Iguana perched on the scoreboard, before doing a lap of the court while tournament staff desperately tried to catch it.
Haas took a selfie with the Iguana (Picture: Sky Sports) It was having a great time (Picture: Sky Sports) It did a lap around the court (Picture: Sky Sports) And it was eventually caught (Picture: Sky Sports) Haas certainly seemed amused by the events and made sure he got a selfie with the creature, who clearly is just a big tennis fan.
Eventually, the iguana was escorted away from the action and he’s definitely enjoyed his 15 minutes of fame!
MORE: Paire loses the plot and smashes multiple racquets at Miami Open
